001package imagingbook.lib.filter.examples;
002
003import imagingbook.lib.filter.GenericFilterVector;
004import imagingbook.lib.image.data.PixelPack;
005
006// a custom filter that provides its own progress data
007public class FilterShowProgressExample extends GenericFilterVector {
008
009        // variables for progress reporting
010        private int maxCnt = 5000;
011        private int cnt;
012        
013        @Override
014        protected void initFilter(PixelPack source, PixelPack target) { 
015        }
016        
017        @Override
018        protected void initPass(PixelPack source, PixelPack target) {
019        }
020        
021        @Override
022        protected int passesRequired() {
023                return 3;       // needs 3 passes
024        }
025        
026        @Override
027        protected float[] doPixel(PixelPack source, int u, int v) {
028                float[] dummy = new float[3];
029                float sum = 0;
030                cnt = 0;
031                for (int i = 0; i < maxCnt; i++) {
032                        this.cnt = i;
033                        sum += (float) Math.sqrt(i); // some dummy work
034                }
035                cnt = 0;
036                dummy[0] = sum;
037                return dummy;
038        }
039        
040        // -------------------------------------------------------------
041        
042        @Override
043        protected double reportProgress() {
044                return (double) this.cnt / this.maxCnt;
045        }
046        
047//      public static void main(String[] args) {
048//              GenericFilter filter = new FilterShowProgressExample();
049//              ProgressMonitor mon = new ProgressMonitor(filter, 500);
050//              mon.start();
051//              PixelPack pp = new PixelPack(400, 300, 3, null);
052//              filter.applyTo(pp);
053//              mon.terminate();
054//      }
055
056}
